To run this Svelte app on a server, you'll first need to build it into a production-ready version and then serve it using a web server. Here's a step-by-step guide:

1. Install dependencies and build the app:

Make sure you have installed all the required dependencies by running the following command in your project directory:
```bash
npm install
```
Next, build the production-ready version of your Svelte app:
```bash
npm run build
```
This command generates a `build` folder in the `public` directory containing the compiled and optimized app files.

1. Choose a web server:

You can use any web server to serve your app's static files. Some popular options include Nginx, Apache, and Node.js-based servers like Express or `serve`. In this example, we'll use `serve` as it's easy to set up and use for serving static files.

First, install the `serve` package globally:
```bash
npm install -g serve
```
1. Serve the app:

Now, use the `serve` command to serve the `public` folder, which contains the `build` folder with your compiled app:
```bash
serve public
```
By default, your app will be accessible at `http://localhost:5000`. You can change the port by using the `-p` or `--port` flag:
```bash
serve public -p 3000
```
Now your Svelte app is running on a server, and you can access it through the specified address.

If you want to deploy the app to a production server, you can follow a similar process but use a more production-ready web server like Nginx or Apache, and configure your domain and SSL certificates accordingly.
